column4: when you say find a channel operator.. you mean here or some website?
depends on the chipset of the cards.
well i got 1 ATI and 1 nvidia  and 3 displays
ive heard it can be done.. but only seen 1 person ever in this channel that was doing it.
windows works fine with the 2 cars  but linux disable the nvidia
no idea. he was in here a few days back. It will also depend on how new the cards are.. a lot of the ati cards are not supported by the fglrx drivers any more.
you did install the nvidia drivers for that card?
i got 2 drivers on the driverJokey list... ATI is working and nvidia show me the ubuntu logo
all i can do is suggest checking the forums.
use some tool like unetbootin, or lili, or the usb-disk cerator tool and add a persstant save file.. or just do a normal install to the flash drive.
i did the persistant data on the USB device but every time i restart the pc it show me the Live or install menu.... i whis to use my usb as a portable Disck and go to any computer i desire
so. if you seelct live.. it should have the changes you did saved..
changes like plugins  email paswords an all that stuff????
yes. it has a persstant 'home' and 'system' file it keeps changes to.
but a 'full' install to a flash drive may be more flexiable and faster
that sounds nice but im worry about the system compatibility... i want to plug the same usb device in 4 diferent computers
then stick with a persistant save. and dont install any extra drivers.. but hope the default drivers work for nvidia/ati ssytems
